org.sd.cluster.job
Interface WorkFactory

All Known Subinterfaces:
PublishableWorkFactory
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWorkFactory, BasicWorkFactory, ClientWorkFactory, PartitionWorkFactory, ReadingWorkFactory, SimpleWorkFactory, StreamingWorkFactory, TrackingWorkFactory
public interface WorkFactory

Interface for iterating over units of work.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Method Summary
 void addAllToFront(java.util.List<UnitOfWork> workUnits)
          Add all of the work units to the front of this factory's work.
 void addToBack(UnitOfWork workUnit)
          Add the work unit to the back of this factory's work.

          Add the work unit to the front of this factory's work.
 void close()
          Explicitly close the resources used by the work factory.
 UnitOfWork getNext()
          Get the next unit of work in a thread-safe way.
 long getRemainingEstimate()
          Get an estimate for the remaining work to do.
 boolean isComplete()
          Report whether all units retrieved have been released or accounted for.
 void release(UnitOfWork unitOfWork)
          Release the unit of work in a thread-safe way.

getNext

UnitOfWork getNext()
                   throws java.io.IOException
Get the next unit of work in a thread-safe way.

Returns:
the next unit of work or null if there are no more.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

release

void release(UnitOfWork unitOfWork)
             throws java.io.IOException
Release the unit of work in a thread-safe way.

Behavior is undefined if a unit of work is re-released.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

close

           throws java.io.IOException
Explicitly close the resources used by the work factory.
